title.narrative: CAPACITY TO ENSURE Open Defecation Free (ODF) STATUS,ACCESS TOSAFE DRINKING WATER AND HYGIENE PRACTICES

description.narrative: Deprived communities, schools and health facilities have increased capacity to ensure open-defecation-free status, access to and use of a safely managed drinking water supply, and individual and collective adoption of appropriate hygiene practices, which contributes to Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Sanitation, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: WATER, SANITATION & HYGIENE- Improved and equitable use of safe drinking water, sanitation, and healthy environments and improved hygiene practices in deprived provinces and vulnerable areas.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Deprived communities, schools and health facilities have increased capacity to ensure open-defecation-free status, access to anduse of a safely managed drinking water supply, and individual and collective adoption of appropriate hygiene practices

description.narrative: In the reporting period 145,366 people from 64 communities across 20 provinces gained access to at least basic drinking water services, which is beyond the target set for 2021 in the rolling plan, despite the major challenges faced in 2021 from the ongoing Covid-19 pandemic, and collapse of government and take over by the de facto authorities. Under the community sanitation component of the WASH programme, 860 communities achieved Open Defecation Free (ODF) certification, covering 419,160 people in 15 districts across 9 provinces. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:11/01/2022
